description:
Settings file for the acoustic system describing the sample space, beam and topology.
Schema on github: https://github.com/Engineer2B/PowerCalculator-Schemas
title: Settings of the acoustic system

___Power.description: Total amount of power that the transducer sends out in [W].

___TrajectoryInterval.description: Duration for which a focus is sonicated in [s].

___Focus.description: Position towards which the focus is phase-shifted in [m, m, m].

___ImagingTiming.description: The timeframe accross which imaging occurs in [s].

___SonicationTiming.description: The timeframe accross which sonication occurs in [s].

___Frequency.description: Frequency at which the transducer elements oscillate in [Hz].

___Inclination.description: X or Y axis rotation angle in radians.

___Azimuth.description: Z axis rotation angle in radians.

___Translation.description: Vector of translation in [m, m, m] (if ScaleFactor is 1).

___LatticeSpacing.description: Spacing between points inside the lattice box in [m, m, m].

___PowerLimit.description: If the power of the ray goes below this limit in [W], no new rays can be generated from the ray.

___RaysPerElement.description: Number of rays per transducer element.

___LatticeExtrema.description: Minimal and maximal values that describe the lattice box in [m].

___X.description: Minimal and maximal X values of the box in [m].

___Y.description: Minimal and maximal Y values of the box in [m].

___Z.description: Minimal and maximal Z values of the box in [m].

___ThetaMax.description: Maximal angle up to which rays are generated by the transducer elements in [rad]. Theta is defined for each individual transducer element as the angle between the direction of the element and the plane in which it lies.
